name: Healing Yin Yoga Session with Reishi Mushroom
description: We are exciting to bring to you a one of a kind experience at the Studio, the perfect way to unwind and relax on a Sunday evening and get you ready for the week!This event by Nuvedo X Copper + Cloves which is all about exploring and experiencing the amazing healing power of mushrooms!Yin Yoga is a slow yet powerful healing practice where each asana is held for 3-5 minutes at a time. When combined with the soothing properties of reishi mushroom, you can expect to experience a calm and regulated nervous system by the end of this experience!At the start of the candlelit yoga class, led by the wonderful Julia, you will receive a functional mushroom extract dose, reishi, so you can experience the beneficial effects during the class itself.The 90 minute practice will be followed by a sharing feast at the Studio by the Copper + Cloves Chef team. We will incorporate functional mushrooms into the brunch, from pan-fried lion's mane on sourdough, to a reishi-cacao balls.Why we are so excited about this unique event:By receiving these extracts during a yoga class centred on synchronising breath and movement you will get the most out of these amazing mushroomsYou will leave this practice feeling more grounded and embodied.During the sharing-feast we'll all eat together so it's a wonderful chance to meet like-minded people.You'll get the chance to try delicious food including functional mushrooms, so you will also receive the nutritional benefits of these fungi.You will learn more about mushrooms and how they can support your journey to health. The team of experts from Nuvedo will help you understand why the extracts are unique and deep dive into the wonderful world of mushrooms.This will be a truly special experience - if you have ever been curious about functional mushrooms and how they could support your health journey, this is the event for you!

location.name: Copper + Cloves

organizer.description: We are all about nourishing food and creating spaces for connection!

name: River Realms: An Immersive VR experience @ Sabha
description: This event is a part of Bengaluru Hubba, a citywide Arts and Culture fest from Nov 30 - Dec 16Bengaluru—a city of innovation, growth, and resilience, sustaining millions each day. But have you ever wondered what truly fuels this metropolis? Over 100 km away lies its lifeline: the Cauvery River, the single source capable of quenching the city’s vast thirst. Rising to an elevation of 920 meters above sea level, every drop that reaches Bengaluru is part of an awe-inspiring engineering feat, delivering life-giving water across immense distances and elevations. While this feat of human ingenuity is indeed impressive, it underscores a critical reality: the city’s reliance on a distant water source is a fragile solution, one that becomes increasingly unsustainable as demand grows.In this immersive experience on the Apple Vision Pro, transport to the heart of the Cauvery in a way like never before. With stunning 16K 180° video narration, stories of conservation and wildlife, you’ll feel the river’s currents as if you’re standing on its banks, surrounded by the beauty of lush landscapes, misty hills, and abundant wildlife. Glide along the river and experience the peaceful yet powerful journey of its waters, as they make their way to our city.Dive Deeper with AR and 3D ModelsGet up close with interactive 3D models that reveal the rich wildlife, diverse plants, and the complex infrastructure behind this remarkable journey. Watch as dams, pipelines, and pumping stations come to life, illustrating the sophisticated system that transports Cauvery’s finite waters over vast distances to sustain Bengaluru. Feel the river's flow, witness the delicate balance between nature and engineering, and understand both the marvel and the responsibility of relying on a distant water source.An Experience Like No OtherThis is more than just an experience—it’s an invitation to understand the delicate balance that keeps Bengaluru thriving. Join us at Bengaluru Hubba on the Apple Vision Pro for “Bengaluru: A City Fueled by the Cauvery” Discover the lifeblood of our city, and be part of the journey that brings water, life, and hope to millions.

name: The Breakfast Club
description: We’re excited to invite you to an exclusive breakfast and coffee preview of Muro Café, where Bangalore will experience the best of Asian breakfast and a celebration of Single Origin Coffees of Karnataka’s finest coffee estates. Join us on every Saturday & Sunday for our Asian breakfast menu.From 9 a.m. to 12:00 p.m., experience Muro Cafe's unique twist on breakfast; from rich Crab Omelettes and indulgent Hong Kong French Toast to creamy Basque Cheesecake & more.Celebrate food, community, and the joy of coming together. Muro: https://www.instagram.com/murocafeblr/

name: Once upon a time in Johnson market.
description: Join us for a walk through Johnson Market and its surrounding areas discovering this quaint British-era marketplace from a fresh perspective. We'll delve into the area's unique Shia heritage tracing back to a Persian man who made this place his home decades ago. Few people know about the roads and localities named after him and his descendants—a fascinating piece of Bangalore’s history.Our journey includes a stop at a legendary local bakery sipping on Sulaimani chai learning about the martyrs of Karbala and visiting a historic church.We’ll begin with a brief introduction to the area before exploring its heritage sites. Along the way you’ll enjoy a taste of local delicacies in between the stories of history.**Instructions:**- Wear comfortable footwear and bring a cap.- Since we’ll visit places of worship please dress respectfully.- Photography is allowed at most locations unless otherwise noted.

name: Kavitayon Ki Dastak
description: Dialogues Cafe brings to you a Sunday full of kavitā and shāyari!If you love writing or just listening to Hindi poetry or couplets of shāyari or lyrical ghazals — we invite you to a poetic sundowner filled with hindi writing and sher-shāyari. Let`s get together for `Kavitāyon Ki Dastak`, an open mic — or rather an open mehfil — to set your mood and make you feel wholesome."utth ke mehfil se mat chale jānātum se raushan ye konā konā hai"Be a part of this community, share the love and lehzā with your words. Come join us to have agood time reciting, listening and absorbing the creativity of Hindi artists and shāyars. Wrap up your week with mellow vibes and be rejuvenated to start the next week afresh!Venue: Dialogues Café, KoramangalaEvery Second Sunday of the MonthTime: 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm

organizer.description: Dialogues Cafe is a warm, homely space in Koramangala where natural light meets community vibes. Enjoy freshly made, minimalist cuisine while engaging in open mics, book clubs, and more. Whether you’re here to work, create, or connect, Dialogues Cafe is your space to belong.

name: Dialogues with Books
description: Dialogues with Books Join us for our book club meetup every third Sunday of the month. Bring along your favorite book, the book you are currently reading, or any book that had an impact on you. Share your experience reading the book with fellow bibliophiles and participate in winding and fun discussions around the joy of reading. Do all this while sipping on coffee/tea or having a hot tasty snack from our cafe! Your Host - Bharat is an avid reader with a penchant for classical literature and philosophy. He also dabbles in writing with a diverse portfolio of works across tech, philosophy, magical realism and fantasy. His reading diet includes a mix of fiction and non-fiction with his favorite novels being The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald, The Movable feast by Hemmingway and Crime and Punishment by Dostoevsky.Note: Rs.100 as cover is part of the ticket price.

name: Ek Shaam Poetry Ke Naam
description: Ek Shaam Poetry Ke Naam - A room. Some beanbags and cushions. Souls lost in Hindi poetry and Urdu verse. Open the doors, and enter the world of Bachchan, Dinkar, Akhtar, Ghalib, Sahir, and others.With Ek Shaam Poetry Ke Naam, we bring to you an evening of hour-long recital of poetry written by masters of Hindi and Urdu. Interspersed in these recitals are stories of their life, translations of their works and a discovery of the nuances in their written word. Once in a while, you might find a surprise - a little something out of the box designed for the lover of poetry.Come join us - the mehfil awaits. (Please note: This is NOT an Open Mic)—-Abhilash is an entrepreneur, a corporate educator, and a storyteller. He has spent much of his life reading, memorising and reciting poems of great Hindi/Urdu poets. For years, he has shared this love for poetry with close friends, colleagues and family.Radha is a story-teller, chemistry researcher, traveller, writer, mythology buff, mother, product builder, and bathroom singer - in no particular order. She grew up surrounded by the works of some of our best poets, with her mother reciting Bachchan and Dinkar and her father playing ghazals on the old tape recorder. What started as their separate childhood passions, now finds a collective expression in Ek Shaam Poetry Ke Naam

name: Pettah walk in Cottonpet : In search of faith.
description: In our fourth walk in the Pettah area we take the guests on a journey in search of "Faith".On this walk in the western part of Kempe Gowda's Pettah area we visit the shrine of the biggest Sufi dargah in Bangalore. We not only learn more about Sufism but learn about how this dargah has promoted communal harmony since the past two centuries and more.We then visit an ayurvedic massage center to see how bones are set right. Legend has it that at one of these centers was patronized by the Maharaja of Mysore as would the pehelwans in these areas who practiced khusti in the numerous akhadas.We also visit an old temple/s associated with a saint/s who left his/their mark on the locality. If time permits we will also visit a garadi mane & a heritage lodge close by.Last but not the least we treat our guests to a nice traditional South Indian breakfast at a heritage restaurant in the area.

name: Roots of Resilience: Discover the Art of Gardening
description: Immerse yourself in the serene beauty of nature with a hands-on gardening workshop designed to help you cultivate both thriving plants and a sense of inner calm.This 90-minute experience is perfect for anyone looking to learn the fundamentals of gardening while exploring how this mindful practice can reduce stress, enhance well-being, and nurture personal growth. From connecting with the earth to tending to your own patch of greenery, you’ll walk away with practical skills and a renewed sense of balance.🌱 What You’ll Experience:A calming, outdoor space perfect for learning and relaxation.Step-by-step guidance on gardening essentials, from planting to care.The joy of digging into the soil and reconnecting with nature’s rhythms.Insights into how gardening fosters resilience and mindfulness.Whether you're an experienced gardener or new to the practice, this workshop is tailored for all skill levels. Tools and materials are provided, and activities are adapted to ensure accessibility and comfort for everyone.What to Bring:Comfortable, outdoor-appropriate clothing.A willingness to get your hands dirty and your heart refreshed.Join us for this grounding experience, where you’ll grow more than just a garden—you’ll grow yourself.🌿 Spaces are limited—reserve your spot now!

description: Step into Legacy Leaves: Pursuing Independent Directorship, a transformative workshop that guides aspiring and experienced leaders in navigating the path to impactful boardroom roles. Whether you’re new to governance or looking to refine your approach, this workshop offers valuable tools to build confidence and clarity.What You’ll Experience:Reflect on your leadership values and aspirations.Learn key skills for effective governance and collaboration.Connect with like-minded leaders and share insights.Gain actionable guidance from an expert director.This session is designed for all levels of experience and offers a supportive environment to deepen your leadership potential. Whether you're an adult or a kid (5+ years), this is your chance to craft a unique, eco-friendly masterpiece.What You’ll Learn:Use a variety of vibrant colors and traditional wooden blocks to design your tote/drawstring/pouch bags.Walk away with a stunning, personalized  bag that’s perfect for everyday use or gifting!Schedule:📅 14th & 15th December 2024 🕒 Anytime between 12 PM – 7 PM ⏳ 1 hours per sessionPrice: 399/499/599 (drawstring/tote/pouch)Join Our Better Planet for this hands-on workshop as part of the Conscious Souk Exhibition. All materials, including colors, and blocks, will be provided. Just bring your enthusiasm!

name: The Courtyard Baithak - An Evening of Ghazals
description: The Courtyard Baithak series is curated by tabla wizard and prodigy Trilochan Kampli, who with his uncompromising standards in music, evokes the best from every artist that he invites to perform. We are bringing musicians and audiences together on a sublime musical journey.Exclusive gatherings, quiet strains of exquisite music, and dedicated artists across selected genres - The Courtyard Baithak series promises a true classical musical experience.Ghazal Night Highlights:Vocals: Sangeeta Lahiri BhattacharjeeTabla: Trilochan KampliSarangi: Sarfaraaz KhanAn evening of soulful melodies, intricate rhythms, and timeless expressions awaits!Please note: The ticket includes performance onlyAbout the artist- Sangeeta Lahiri BhattacharjeeSangeeta Lahiri Bhattacharjee, daughter of sitar maestro Sri Rabindranath Lahiri, is a dynamic vocalist trained under legendary gurus like Pt. Chinmoy Lahiri and Ustad Ghulam Akbar Khan. Known for her powerful yet soulful voice, she excels in Hindustani classical, thumri, ghazal, and Sufi music. A recipient of prestigious awards like “Surmani” and an A-graded artist with All India Radio, Sangeeta has performed at renowned venues across India and the USA. She also mentors budding artists through her Shruti School of Music, leaving an indelible mark on the world of Indian classical music.Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Children aged 5 and older require a ticket.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. name: Home Alone (1990) Screening | Family Movie Night
description: Family Movie Night at The Studio, Courtyard, ShantinagarJoin us as we watch a series of carefully curated rare masterpieces from around the world, made just for kids. Watch this film while cozying up with your family!About the movie:Home Alone (1990) is a family comedy that follows Kevin McCallister, an eight-year-old boy accidentally left behind when his family departs for a Christmas vacation. Initially thrilled to have the house to himself, Kevin soon finds himself defending it from two bumbling burglars, Harry and Marv, using clever and hilariously painful traps. As Kevin learns the value of family and courage, the movie delivers heartwarming moments amid the laughs. Directed by Chris Columbus and starring Macaulay Culkin, Home Alone became a holiday classic for its mix of humor and festive charm.Why should your kid attend this screening? Classic Holiday Tale: Home Alone introduces children to a heartwarming, festive story filled with humor and adventure.Resilience & Creativity: Kevin’s inventive ways of defending his home inspire problem-solving and quick thinking.Cultural Icon: As a beloved holiday classic, watching Home Alone connects children to a piece of pop culture history.Community Viewing Experience: Enjoying the film in a shared space enhances the joy and excitement of the story, creating lasting memories.And of course, it's Home Alone!!!Join us for Family Movie Night – where the magic of storytelling knows no bounds!Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.The Event is taking place at Courtyard's indoor Studio space on the second floor.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Children above the age of 3 need a ticket to attend the event.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.

name: Vision Board Party : Envision your 2025
description: Reflect, Reimagine, and Realign for a fulfilling 2025. Shwetha Sivaraman is a corporate banker turned self-mastery coach, passionate about maximizing life for herself and others. She founded ‘Being Meraklis’ in her quest to understand what it takes to Thrive Consciously and support others in the journey of becoming. Through podcasts, workshops, and coaching, she facilitates the journey from self-awareness to self-transformation, so high achievers can find both success and peace. Her first book Far From Fine was recently published by Hay House India. The book offers a roadmap for personal transformation to move from living on autopilot to being intentional.In this 2-hour workshop, we will: - Reflect on our experiences from 2024 and encapsulate our learnings and wisdom- A guided meditation on letting go and creating space for our intentions in 2025- Guided journaling exercise to realign our being and doing towards our most important goals.

name: Christmas Eve Wine Dinner
description: Christmas Eve Wine Dinner at O’ver CoffeeJoin us for a magical evening filled with holiday cheer and indulgence at O'ver Coffee! Celebrate Christmas Eve with a special Wine Dinner Menu , crafted to delight your senses and elevate your festive spirit. Savour a 5-course gourmet dinner featuring a blend of classic European flavours, with both vegetarian and non-vegetarian options to suit every palate. Each dish is carefully paired with hand-selected wines to enhance the experience, making it a memorable night of flavours and warmth.MenuPass arounds:Asparagus, Pomelo & grapefruit crostiniParmesan and toasted sunflower seedsSmoked salmon & Cream cheese CrostiniPomegranate arils & balsamic reductionGuacamole, Jalapeno & Coriander toastCherry tomatoes & EVOOProsciutto with Sun-dried tomato & Ricotta stuffedAperitif: Prosecco “Villa Sandi IL Fresco DOC”AppetizersRoasted Chestnut Soup with truffle oilVelvety chestnut soup garnished with a drizzle of truffle oilORRoasted Chestnut Soup with Smoked duckVelvety chestnut soup garnished with a drizzle of Extra virgin olive oilWhite Wine: Berton Vineyard Metal Range “Vermentino”Main course -1Chicken Ballotine with Ricotta Herb Tender chicken wrapped around a stuffing of fresh ricotta, herbs and served with a tangy cranberry sauceORWild Mushroom and Spinach RisottoPorcini, Shiitake & Button mushroom, Parmesan & Extra virgin olive oilRosé Wine: Fantini Calalenta IGT “Rosé”Main course -2Herb-Crusted Roast Rack of Lamb Served with a red wine and rosemary reductionORStuffed Butternut Squash with Quinoa, Cranberries and SageYellow onions, garlic, celery, pecans, and thyme and parsleySide Dishes for Main Course-2Christmas Brussels Sprouts with PancettaCrispy roasted Brussels sprouts sautéed with savoury pancetta, adding a delightful crunch and flavour.ORRoasted Brussels Sprouts with Walnuts and Balsamic GlazeBrussels sprouts roasted with crunchy walnuts & balsamic reduction.ORMashed Potatoes with Parmesan and Truffle ButterCreamy mashed potatoes enhanced with a touch of truffle butter and finished with freshly grated parmesan.Red Wine: Berton Vineyard “Durif”DESSERTS:Bûche de Noël&Spiced Apple Crumble with Vanilla Bean Ice CreamSparkling wine: Villa Sandi Dolce “Spumante”Date: Christmas Eve, December 24th  Time: 7:00 PM Let’s raise a glass and toast to a festive, flavourful, and unforgettable Christmas Eve at O’ver Coffee.Cheers to good food, great wine, and even better company! Please Note:Please choose either the vegetarian or non-vegetarian set menu. The dishes cannot be exchanged between the two options.Please arrive at the venue by 7:00pm. We will be serving pass-arounds from 7:00pm to 7:45pm. Following this, we will proceed to the next course.Seating is allocated by our team, either at their discretion or on a first-come, first-served basis. Please note that reservations are made for individual seats rather than entire tables.  If you have specific seating preferences, please feel free to reach out to our team in advance (subject to availability).  In case of cancellations or no-shows, payments are non-refundable, as all sales are final.  Paid valet parking available and the cars will be parked in BBMP allocated street parking bays.Photographs and videos of the event participants may be used on our social media handles. If you prefer not be featured, please inform our team.Thank you for your understanding, and we look forward to hosting you!

name: Smash Guys Burger Residency with Beer
description: Smash Guys Burger Residency with BeerThe Smash Guys Burger Residency with Beer marks a thrilling new chapter for The Conservatory, a space that has become a hotspot for culinary innovation over the past two years. We've hosted some of the country’s most exciting chefs and restaurants, recently venturing into international collaborations that have elevated Bengaluru’s dining scene.Now, we’re taking it one step further by introducing a unique residency experience—and who better to kick it off than the Smash Guys? With their expertly crafted burgers and a mission to redefine the city’s burger game, this month-long residency promises to be a delicious adventure you won’t want to miss.Smash Guys is the latest creation from Nikhil and AB Gupta, the culinary masterminds behind The Pizza Bakery and Paris Panini. This time, their mission is bold: to celebrate the art of the burger by bringing the finest styles from across the globe under one roof.After months of meticulously crafting every bite since their smash hit debut at The Conservatory, they’re now ready to take things up a notch with an exciting month-long residency.Smash Guys is here to redefine Bengaluru’s burger scene, filling the flavor void with juicy patties, crisp buns, and creative combinations that promise to thrill every burger lover in town.The dream team behind Smash Guys: Chef Guru is the Chef Partner at The Pizza Bakery & Paris Panini. Graduated from Le Cordon Bleu, Australia, his expertise in balancing textures and creating unique sauce combinations brings an unexpected twist to classic burger elements. His commitment to sourcing premium ingredients ensures every component tells its own story while contributing to a harmonious whole.Chef Adithya Kidambi is our friendly neighborhood kombucha scientist. He has built mossant into the best craft kombucha brand in the city, but what few know about him is that he is a trained Chef and self-taught burger scholar who delivered burgers to people during the lockdown post which he sold out at several pop-ups in the city. Adi excels in styles like the Nashville Chicken, Smash Buff/Lamb classics, and Asian-inspired burgers using ingredients like kimchi and miso.Chef Suby is all about chasing the ULTIMATE BURGER DREAM. His obsession with achieving the perfect meat-to-fat ratio and that caramelised crust has led him to experiment with countless grinds and smashing techniques. Chef Rohil brings an elegant touch to the veg side of our menu. He completes our trio with his innovative approach to flavour building, and fine-tuning the perfect balance of flavour and texture.Beer on TapTo make this residency even better, The Conservatory will be serving up refreshing beer on tap throughout the month. We've hosted some of the country’s most exciting chefs and restaurants, recently venturing into international collaborations that have elevated Bengaluru’s dining scene.Now, we’re taking it one step further by introducing a unique residency experience—and who better to kick it off than the Smash Guys? With their expertly crafted burgers and a mission to redefine the city’s burger game, this month-long residency promises to be a delicious adventure you won’t want to miss.Smash Guys is the latest creation from Nikhil and AB Gupta, the culinary masterminds behind The Pizza Bakery and Paris Panini. This time, their mission is bold: to celebrate the art of the burger by bringing the finest styles from across the globe under one roof.After months of meticulously crafting every bite since their smash hit debut at The Conservatory, they’re now ready to take things up a notch with an exciting month-long residency.Smash Guys is here to redefine Bengaluru’s burger scene, filling the flavor void with juicy patties, crisp buns, and creative combinations that promise to thrill every burger lover in town.The dream team behind Smash Guys: Chef Guru is the Chef Partner at The Pizza Bakery & Paris Panini. Graduated from Le Cordon Bleu, Australia, his expertise in balancing textures and creating unique sauce combinations brings an unexpected twist to classic burger elements. His commitment to sourcing premium ingredients ensures every component tells its own story while contributing to a harmonious whole.Chef Adithya Kidambi is our friendly neighborhood kombucha scientist. He has built mossant into the best craft kombucha brand in the city, but what few know about him is that he is a trained Chef and self-taught burger scholar who delivered burgers to people during the lockdown post which he sold out at several pop-ups in the city. Adi excels in styles like the Nashville Chicken, Smash Buff/Lamb classics, and Asian-inspired burgers using ingredients like kimchi and miso.Chef Suby is all about chasing the ULTIMATE BURGER DREAM. His obsession with achieving the perfect meat-to-fat ratio and that caramelised crust has led him to experiment with countless grinds and smashing techniques. Chef Rohil brings an elegant touch to the veg side of our menu. He completes our trio with his innovative approach to flavour building, and fine-tuning the perfect balance of flavour and texture.Beer on TapTo make this residency even better, The Conservatory will be serving up refreshing beer on tap throughout the month. Pair your favorite Smash Guys burger with a perfectly chilled pint, and let the ultimate burger-and-beer experience begin!The Burger MenuNon- Vegetarian MenuBuffalo Chicken (Rs. 585)Buffalo sauce-dunked fried chicken, grilled onions, blue cheese sauce, lettuceKatsu Chicken (Rs.585)Katsu curry-dunked fried chicken, togarashi flakes, apple slaw, grilled onions, pickles, garlic aioli, lettuceTeriyaki (Rs.585)Teriyaki sauce-dunked fried chicken, togarashi flakes, apple slaw, pickles, garlic aioli, lettuceFoster Chicken Smash (Rs.585)Double smash chicken patty, cheese slice, chimichurri, pickles, smash sauce, lettuceOklahoma Smash (Rs.650)Double white onion smash patty, American cheese, chimichurri, pickles, smash sauce, lettuceChilli Cheese Smash (Rs.650)Double smash patty, American cheese, chili cheese sauce, homemade chili sofrito, smash saucePB & Bacon Smash (Rs.689)Smash patty, American cheese, crunchy peanut butter, sliced red paprika, crispy bacon, smash sauce8 hr. Braised Brisket (Rs.689)Pickled onion smash patty, BBQ braised brisket, smash sauceThe Dalston Dip (Rs.715)Double smash patty, double American cheese, grilled onions, smash sauce, served with a homemade Dalston dunk bowlThe Flinstone (Rs.715)Smash patty, American cheese, torched bone marrow, pickles, smash sauceDiane Smash (Rs.741)Double smash patty, double cheese, smash sauce, grilled onions, Diane sauceVegetarian MenuOyster Mushroom Karaage (Rs. 520)Fried oyster mushrooms, togarashi flakes, pickles, truffle aioli, truffle oil, lettuceKorean Fried Paneer (Rs. 598)Gochujang-glazed paneer, apple slaw, scallion relish, garlic aioli, lettuceBlack Bean (Rs. 520)Black bean patty, cheese slice, pickles, smash sauce, lettuceSidesTruffle Fries (Rs.390)Truffle aioli, parmesan, parsleySaucy Diane Fries (Rs.416)Diane sauce (contains b**f), bacon, parmesan, parsleyDessertDeep Fried Oreos (Rs.390)Custard, dulce de lecheOld Monk Chocolate Mousse (Rs.390)Custard, Cocoa dustTerms and Conditions :Please note, INR 1000 from the ticket price is redeemable against the food and beverage menuGuests must be of a legal drinking age to consume alcohol at the eventThe management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an eventConservatory is located on the 2nd floor of courtyard which is a 44 steps climb upDo not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.Children aged 7 and above require a ticket to attend the meal. If you are bringing a child under 7, please inform us in advance, as we do not have a baby seat at the venue.The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.Management will entertain no liability or claims arising due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval.Please note that both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes are prepared in the same kitchen.The menu is subject to adjustments/ changes at the discretion of the chefs.Please note, tickets once booked cannot be shifted to another datePhotographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.

We've hosted some of the country’s most exciting chefs and restaurants, recently venturing into international collaborations that have elevated Bengaluru’s dining scene.Now, we’re taking it one step further by introducing a unique residency experience—and who better to kick it off than the Smash Guys? With their expertly crafted burgers and a mission to redefine the city’s burger game, this month-long residency promises to be a delicious adventure you won’t want to miss.Smash Guys is the latest creation from Nikhil and AB Gupta, the culinary masterminds behind The Pizza Bakery and Paris Panini. This time, their mission is bold: to celebrate the art of the burger by bringing the finest styles from across the globe under one roof.After months of meticulously crafting every bite since their smash hit debut at The Conservatory, they’re now ready to take things up a notch with an exciting month-long residency.Smash Guys is here to redefine Bengaluru’s burger scene, filling the flavor void with juicy patties, crisp buns, and creative combinations that promise to thrill every burger lover in town.The dream team behind Smash Guys: Chef Guru is the Chef Partner at The Pizza Bakery & Paris Panini. Graduated from Le Cordon Bleu, Australia, his expertise in balancing textures and creating unique sauce combinations brings an unexpected twist to classic burger elements. His commitment to sourcing premium ingredients ensures every component tells its own story while contributing to a harmonious whole.Chef Adithya Kidambi is our friendly neighborhood kombucha scientist. He has built mossant into the best craft kombucha brand in the city, but what few know about him is that he is a trained Chef and self-taught burger scholar who delivered burgers to people during the lockdown post which he sold out at several pop-ups in the city. Adi excels in styles like the Nashville Chicken, Smash Buff/Lamb classics, and Asian-inspired burgers using ingredients like kimchi and miso.Chef Suby is all about chasing the ULTIMATE BURGER DREAM. His obsession with achieving the perfect meat-to-fat ratio and that caramelised crust has led him to experiment with countless grinds and smashing techniques. Chef Rohil brings an elegant touch to the veg side of our menu. He completes our trio with his innovative approach to flavour building, and fine-tuning the perfect balance of flavour and texture.Beer on TapTo make this residency even better, The Conservatory will be serving up refreshing beer on tap throughout the month. Pair your favorite Smash Guys burger with a perfectly chilled pint, and let the ultimate burger-and-beer experience begin!The Burger MenuNon- Vegetarian MenuBuffalo Chicken (Rs. 585)Buffalo sauce-dunked fried chicken, grilled onions, blue cheese sauce, lettuceKatsu Chicken (Rs.585)Katsu curry-dunked fried chicken, togarashi flakes, apple slaw, grilled onions, pickles, garlic aioli, lettuceTeriyaki (Rs.585)Teriyaki sauce-dunked fried chicken, togarashi flakes, apple slaw, pickles, garlic aioli, lettuceFoster Chicken Smash (Rs.585)Double smash chicken patty, cheese slice, chimichurri, pickles, smash sauce, lettuceOklahoma Smash (Rs.650)Double white onion smash patty, American cheese, chimichurri, pickles, smash sauce, lettuceChilli Cheese Smash (Rs.650)Double smash patty, American cheese, chili cheese sauce, homemade chili sofrito, smash saucePB & Bacon Smash (Rs.689)Smash patty, American cheese, crunchy peanut butter, sliced red paprika, crispy bacon, smash sauce8 hr. Braised Brisket (Rs.689)Pickled onion smash patty, BBQ braised brisket, smash sauceThe Dalston Dip (Rs.715)Double smash patty, double American cheese, grilled onions, smash sauce, served with a homemade Dalston dunk bowlThe Flinstone (Rs.715)Smash patty, American cheese, torched bone marrow, pickles, smash sauceDiane Smash (Rs.741)Double smash patty, double cheese, smash sauce, grilled onions, Diane sauceVegetarian MenuOyster Mushroom Karaage (Rs. 520)Fried oyster mushrooms, togarashi flakes, pickles, truffle aioli, truffle oil, lettuceKorean Fried Paneer (Rs. 598)Gochujang-glazed paneer, apple slaw, scallion relish, garlic aioli, lettuceBlack Bean (Rs. 520)Black bean patty, cheese slice, pickles, smash sauce, lettuceSidesTruffle Fries (Rs.390)Truffle aioli, parmesan, parsleySaucy Diane Fries (Rs.416)Diane sauce (contains b**f), bacon, parmesan, parsleyDessertDeep Fried Oreos (Rs.390)Custard, dulce de lecheOld Monk Chocolate Mousse (Rs.390)Custard, Cocoa dustTerms and Conditions :Please note, INR 1000 from the ticket price is redeemable against the food and beverage menuGuests must be of a legal drinking age to consume alcohol at the eventThe management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an eventConservatory is located on the 2nd floor of courtyard which is a 44 steps climb upDo not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.Children aged 7 and above require a ticket to attend the meal. If you are bringing a child under 7, please inform us in advance, as we do not have a baby seat at the venue.The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.Management will entertain no liability or claims arising due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval.Please note that both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes are prepared in the same kitchen.The menu is subject to adjustments/ changes at the discretion of the chefs.Please note, tickets once booked cannot be shifted to another datePhotographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.

His commitment to sourcing premium ingredients ensures every component tells its own story while contributing to a harmonious whole.Chef Adithya Kidambi is our friendly neighborhood kombucha scientist. He has built mossant into the best craft kombucha brand in the city, but what few know about him is that he is a trained Chef and self-taught burger scholar who delivered burgers to people during the lockdown post which he sold out at several pop-ups in the city. Adi excels in styles like the Nashville Chicken, Smash Buff/Lamb classics, and Asian-inspired burgers using ingredients like kimchi and miso.Chef Suby is all about chasing the ULTIMATE BURGER DREAM. His obsession with achieving the perfect meat-to-fat ratio and that caramelised crust has led him to experiment with countless grinds and smashing techniques. Chef Rohil brings an elegant touch to the veg side of our menu. He completes our trio with his innovative approach to flavour building, and fine-tuning the perfect balance of flavour and texture.Beer on TapTo make this residency even better, The Conservatory will be serving up refreshing beer on tap throughout the month. Pair your favorite Smash Guys burger with a perfectly chilled pint, and let the ultimate burger-and-beer experience begin!The Burger MenuNon- Vegetarian MenuBuffalo Chicken (Rs. 585)Buffalo sauce-dunked fried chicken, grilled onions, blue cheese sauce, lettuceKatsu Chicken (Rs.585)Katsu curry-dunked fried chicken, togarashi flakes, apple slaw, grilled onions, pickles, garlic aioli, lettuceTeriyaki (Rs.585)Teriyaki sauce-dunked fried chicken, togarashi flakes, apple slaw, pickles, garlic aioli, lettuceFoster Chicken Smash (Rs.585)Double smash chicken patty, cheese slice, chimichurri, pickles, smash sauce, lettuceOklahoma Smash (Rs.650)Double white onion smash patty, American cheese, chimichurri, pickles, smash sauce, lettuceChilli Cheese Smash (Rs.650)Double smash patty, American cheese, chili cheese sauce, homemade chili sofrito, smash saucePB & Bacon Smash (Rs.689)Smash patty, American cheese, crunchy peanut butter, sliced red paprika, crispy bacon, smash sauce8 hr. name: Backbends Workshop with Sukriti
description: Join us for a transformative backbending workshop designed to deepen your practice, build strength, and cultivate flexibility. This session will focus on unlocking the spine, opening the chest, and improving posture through safe and effective techniques. After the class we'll all enjoy some healthy food together. What you'll learn:Foundational principles of safe backbending to protect your lower back.Techniques to build strength in the shoulders, core, and legs for stability.How to deepen flexibility in the spine, chest, and hips.Breathwork and alignment tips to enhance awareness and reduce strain.Whether you’re new to backbends or looking to refine your practice, this workshop offers something for everyone. Expect a supportive environment, hands-on guidance, and plenty of modifications to suit all levels.Leave feeling empowered, with a more open heart, a stronger body, and greater confidence in your backbends!Who Can Join:Open to all levels, from beginners to seasoned practitioners. Sukriti is an experienced practitioner who can help you to deepen or adjust the poses depending on your flexibility and ability.

description: Muay Thai (Thai Boxing) for Beginners Muay Thai or the Art of Eight Limbs, a martial art originating from Thailand, is a combat sport which involves punches, kicks, elbows, knees and throws. It is one of the best martial arts in terms of building strength, power, endurance, mobility and focus, discipline. name: LoveStories from Indian Heritage-Storytelling show
description: Love stories aren’t only about the hero and heroine for love can rarely exist in isolation. Zealous messengers, art and music as mood enhancers, food as aphrodisiacs, taboos and mores – all play a pivotal role in shaping stories of love. Aparna Jaishankar and Vikram Sridhar rummage through the passages of time to bring you various hues of love etched in our heritage through literature, architecture, songs and poetry through the all- encompassing art form of oral storytelling.   About the Storytellers: Aparna Jaishankar, a Gold Medallist in Social Work from Bharathiar University, transitioned from corporate HR to the Arts, focusing on storytelling and theatre. Partnering with a Life Coach, she conducts workshops on storytelling as a tool in People Management and designs modules on History, Ethics, and Languages for educators. Aparna has lectured at Christ University on Storytelling and Skill Development. Passionate about Indic Mythology, she blends its diverse forms—songs, dance, and rituals—into her narratives, believing in the power of stories to transform perspectives.Vikram Sridhar is a Performance Storyteller, TEDx SPeaker, Theatre Practitioner.and a Narrative based Facilitator combining his various interests and work over 20+ years in Theatre, Conservation and Social Work.He believes in the Desi way of Storytelling as a strong medium of conservation from nature to human relationships as his stories are rooted in folklore, Heritage and Ecology inspired from various communities of the soil . He strongly believes 'A Story a Day keeps the Doctor Away ' not an apple
